page.title: 18MULLARDS FACTORY,CROSSENS
page.content: MULLARDS FACTORY IN CROSSENS WAS BUILT IN 1910 AND WAS THEN NAMED VULCAN MOTORS.MULLARDS TOOK OVER IN 1955 AND ARE PART OF THE PHILLIPS GROUP. NOWADAYS 410 PEOPLE WORK THERE,352 MEN AND 58 WOMEN.THEY OPERATE ON SHIFTS OF 8 HOURS.THE NUMBER OF EMPLOYEES HAS DECREASED SINCE IT FIRST STARTED. MULLARDS MAKE MAGNETIC COMPONENTS TO GO INTO TELEVISIONS,TELEPHONES AND FOR MOTOR MAGNETS.IN THE EARLY DAYS THEY PRODUCED MOTOR CARS,BUSES,AMBULANCES AND SCOOTERS FOR PARATROOPERS. THEY USE SPECIAL POWDERS LIKE OXIDES OF SULPHUR,MANGANESE AND IRON IN THE MANUFACTURING PROCESS. THERE ARE 9 MULLARDS FACTORIES IN THE U.K.,INCLUDING ONE IN LONDON.ALTOGETHER 7000 PEOPLE WORK IN THE U.K., 1000 OF THEM ARE QUALIFIED SCIENTISTS. CAPTAIN MULLARD STARTED MULLARDS.HE DIED AT THE AGE OF 91 YEARS.
